Implement significant figure-like rounding

style_sigfig.Rd

Converts a numeric argument into a string that has been rounded to a significant figure-like number. Scientific notation output is avoided, however, and additional significant figures may be displayed for numbers large numbers. For example, if the number of significant digits requested is 2, 123 will be displayed (rather than 120 or 1.2x10^2).

style_sigfig(x, digits = 2)

Arguments

x

numeric vector
digits

integer specifying the minimum number of significant digits to display

Details

If 2 sig figs are input, the number is rounded to 2 decimal places when abs(x) < 1, 1 decimal place when abs(x) >= 1 & abs(x) < 10, and to the nearest integer when abs(x) >= 10.

Examples

c(0.123, 0.9, 1.1234, 12.345, -0.123, -0.9, -1.1234, -12.345, NA, -0.001) %>%
  style_sigfig()
#>  [1] "0.12"  "0.90"  "1.1"   "12"    "-0.12" "-0.90" "-1.1"  "-12"   NA     
#> [10] "0.00"

Contents
